chapters.title: Chapter 1: The Big Bang
chapters.content: An exploration into the origins of the universe, the Big Bang theory explains the beginning of space, time, and matter.
timeline: 13.8 billion years ago: The Big Bang occurs.
After 10^-43 seconds: First particles begin to form.
After 3 minutes: Protons and neutrons combine to form atomic nuclei.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Formation of Galaxies
chapters.content: This chapter covers the formation of galaxies and the process of star formation.
timeline: 1 billion years after Big Bang: First galaxies start to form.
3 billion years: The Milky Way begins to take shape.
10 billion years: Star formation peaks.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Life of a Star
chapters.content: An in-depth look at the life cycle of stars, from birth to supernova.
timeline: Nebula formation: Birthplace of stars.
Main sequence: Stable phase of a star.
Supernova: The explosive death of a massive star.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
Which element has the atomic number 1?
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
Who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Which country hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics?

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Dark Matter and Energy
chapters.content: A deep dive into the mysterious forces shaping the universe.
timeline: 1930s: Discovery of dark matter.
1998: Discovery of dark energy.
Present: Ongoing research on dark matter and energy.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Cosmic Background Radiation
chapters.content: The remnants of the Big Bang still visible in the universe today.
timeline: 1965: Discovery of cosmic microwave background radiation.
CMB: Proof of the universe's hot, dense origin.
Present: Studies of fluctuations in the CMB.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Fate of the Universe
chapters.content: Various theories about how the universe might end.
timeline: Heat death: Gradual entropy increase.
Big Crunch: Universe collapses in on itself.
Big Rip: Universe tears apart.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: The Space Race
chapters.content: A history of humanityâ€™s quest to reach space.
timeline: 1957: Launch of Sputnik 1.
1969: Apollo 11 lands on the moon.
Present: Private companies join space exploration.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Mars Exploration
chapters.content: Current missions and plans for future human exploration of Mars.
timeline: 1976: Viking 1 lands on Mars.
2004: Rovers Spirit and Opportunity land on Mars.
Present: Ongoing Mars missions and future plans.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: The Future of Space Travel
chapters.content: Looking ahead to new technologies and the possibility of interstellar travel.
timeline: Present: Development of reusable rockets.
Future: Space tourism and colonization of planets.
Far future: Possibility of interstellar travel.
